tree.name: Luka Doncic
tree.tradeDescription: 3-team trade: Lakers acquired Doncic, Kleber, Markieff Morris from Mavericks; sent AD, Max Christie, 2029 1st to Dallas; sent Hood-Schifino and 2025 2nd (LAC own) to Utah

assetsGivenUp.name: Anthony Davis
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: 3-team trade: Lakers acquired Davis from Pelicans for Lonzo Ball, Brandon Ingram, Josh Hart, De'Andre Hunter (#4 pick), 2022 1st, 2023 1st (swap), 2025 1st
assetsGivenUp.note: Traded from Lakers to Dallas Mavericks

assetsGivenUp.name: Lonzo Ball
assetsGivenUp.note: UCLA point guard, drafted 2nd overall by Lakers

assetsGivenUp.name: Brandon Ingram
assetsGivenUp.note: Duke forward, drafted 2nd overall by Lakers

assetsGivenUp.name: Josh Hart
assetsGivenUp.note: Villanova guard, drafted 30th overall by Lakers

assetsGivenUp.name: 2019 LAL 1st Round Pick
assetsGivenUp.note: Lakers' own 1st round pick, became #4 overall, sent to NOP then traded to ATL

assetsGivenUp.name: 2022 LAL 1st Round Pick
assetsGivenUp.note: Lakers' own 1st round pick, sent to NOP

assetsGivenUp.name: 2025 LAL 1st Round Pick
assetsGivenUp.note: Lakers' own 1st round pick, NOP deferred from 2024 to 2025

assetsGivenUp.name: Max Christie
assetsGivenUp.note: Michigan State guard, drafted 35th overall by Lakers

assetsGivenUp.name: 2029 LAL 1st Round Pick
assetsGivenUp.note: Lakers' own 1st round pick, sent to Dallas

assetsGivenUp.name: Jalen Hood-Schifino
assetsGivenUp.note: Indiana guard, drafted 17th overall by Lakers, sent to Utah Jazz

assetsGivenUp.name: 2025 2nd Round Pick (LAC own)
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: Received from Clippers via 4-team trade on Feb 9, 2023
assetsGivenUp.note: LAC own 2nd round pick, acquired in Feb 2023 4-team trade, sent to Utah Jazz
